V.iii.7.2.a
.
Definition:  Nephropathy
Nephropathy
is generally defined as a condition encompassing disease or damage of the kidneys.  Nephropathy is a broader term to describe any condition that impairs renal function. Examples of nephropathy include (but are not limited to) chronic renal disease, nephrotic syndrome, and nephritis.
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 7 - Genitourinary Disabilities
citation: Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 7, Section None
